ARTICLE.TITLE: Knife-wielding man arrested in Wallaceburg
ARTICLE.TEXT:
A 40-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested by Chatham-Kent police after a man waved a knife on McNaughton Avenue in Wallaceburg on Thursday morning.

Police found the man drinking alcohol on the railway tracks with a knife beside him. The man had been released from court last year with several conditions, including not to possess any weapons.

The 40-year-old man was charged with failing to comply with his release conditions.

He was held in custody pending a bail hearing.

Assault charge

A 28-year-old man of no fixed address was charged with assault after Chatham-Kent police responded to a disturbance at a Blenheim residence Thursday night and learned a woman had been assaulted earlier this month.

He was released with a Sept. 23 court date.

Warrants executed

A 55-year-old man was arrested early Friday in Chatham for failing to comply with his release conditions. He was released with a Sept. 23 court date.

A 27-year-old Chatham man wanted on an outstanding warrant was arrested Thursday in Chatham and turned over to Windsor police.

A 36-year-old man of no fixed address wanted for failing to comply with his release conditions was arrested Thursday in London and brought back to Chatham-Kent. He was held in custody pending a bail hearing.

Vehicle impounded

A 31-year-old man Chatham man was charged with being a G1 driver unaccompanied by a qualified driver and two counts of driving while under suspension early Friday.

Police learned during a 4 a.m. traffic stop on Queen Street in Chatham the driver was suspended for unpaid fines and demerit points.

He must attend Provincial Offences Court on Sept. 23. His vehicle was impounded for seven days.

METADATA.description: A 40-year-old man of no fixed address was arrested by Chatham-Kent police after allegedly waving a knife around on McNaughton Avenue in Wallaceburg on Thursday morning.
